intro: Lisianthius mathewsii, commonly known as the Mathews' lisianthus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers are usually pale blue to purple in color, with ray florets surrounding a central disk. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats across Madagascar.
